title: Domain of Even Roots
text: When there is an even root in the formula, we exclude any real numbers that result in a negative number in the radicand.

title: Domain of Even Roots
text: To get the domain of f, we can set the radicand greater than or equal to zero and solve for $$x$$. i.e. Solve the inequality $$x^2+1 \geq 0$$.

title: Domain of Even Roots
text: Notice that $$x^2$$ is always nonnegative and that we are adding one to a number that is guaranteed to be nonnegative. Will the radicand ever be negative?
